sentence: Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) will begin trading ex-dividend on March 07, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.89 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 23, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased HD prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 28.99% increase over prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of HD was $147.81, representing a -0.3% decrease from the 52 week high of $148.26 and a 24% increase over the 52 week low of $119.20.
HD is a part of the Consumer Services sector, which includes companies such as Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) and Sherwin-Williams Company ( SHW ).
HD's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $6.45.
Zacks Investment Research reports HD's forecasted earnings growth in 2018 as 11.36%, compared to an industry average of 15.2%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the HD Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
